## Deposit Async V2.0

The current depositasync() works - but for very long blockchain times (30mins+) we see a timeout. We can not change the blockchain times so we must deal with long times during the deposit process.

[![](https://mermaid.ink/img/eyJjb2RlIjoic2VxdWVuY2VEaWFncmFtXG4gICAgVUktPj5zZXJ2ZXI6IG9wZW4gd2Vic29ja2V0KC90cmFkZXMve3RpZH0pXG4gICAgVUktPj4rc2VydmVyOiBkZXBvc2l0eUFzeW5jKHRpZClcbiAgICBzZXJ2ZXItPj4tVUk6IFJlc3BTdGF0dXMgPT0gT0tcbiAgICBzZXJ2ZXItLT4-IFVJOiBDSEtfQUxMT1dBTkNFXG4gICAgc2VydmVyLS0-PiBVSTogQ1JFQVRFX0NUUlxuICAgIE5vdGUgb3ZlciBVSSxzZXJ2ZXI6IHRpbWUgMTBzZWMgLi4gNDVtaW5zXG4gICAgc2VydmVyLS0-)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/edit/##eyJjb2RlIjoic2VxdWVuY2VEaWFncmFtXG4gICAgVUktPj5zZXJ2ZXI6IG9wZW4gd2Vic29ja2V0KC90cmFkZXMve3RpZH0pXG4gICAgVUktPj4rc2VydmVyOiBkZXBvc2l0eUFzeW5jKHRpZClcbiAgICBzZXJ2ZXItPj4tVUk6IFJlc3BTdGF0dXMgPT0gT0tcbiAgICBzZXJ2ZXItLT4-IFVJOiBDSEtfQUxMT1dBTkNFXG4gICAgc2VydmVyLS0-PiBVSTogQ1JFQVRFX0NUUlxuICAgIE5vdGUgb3ZlciBVSSxzZXJ2ZXI6IHRpbWUxMHNlYyAuLiA0NW1pbnNcbiAgICBzZXJ2ZXItLT4-IFVJOiBERVBPU0lUXG4gICAgc2VydmVyLS0-)

## Adding new state

Adding new state (DEPOSITING) to cover the whole deposit process. The DEPOSIT state now represents the contract has been created and crypto funds are present

```
 CREATED => DEPOSITING => DEPOSIT => FIATSENT => COMPLETED
```

# Changes to the UI

Everything is unchanged, except the server will publish a websocket 'End' message after a number of minutes waiting. The UI must display this message and wait for the user to acknowledge.

Example 'End' timeout message:

```json
{
  "key": "Msg",
  "text": "CREATE_CTR",
  "count": 5
}
...
{
  "key": "End",
  "text": "Transaction taking longer than usual, We will update you by email when complete",
  "count": 6
}
```

Once acknowledged, the depositing page closes and the trade list is refreshed. The trade item card will now display `DEPOSITING` with no buttons but the text `t('Block chain is busy, we will update you by email when complete')`

A new field item `approval` (timestamp) is added, which is set when Depositing has begun. This field can be used to display the number of minutes elapsed so far.
